elements.title: Meratus blue flycatcher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that only six years after its 2016 discovery, the Meratus blue flycatcher (pictured) was found being sold in Indonesian songbird markets?

elements.title: "End Zone" Jones (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "End Zone" Jones ran for a career high in his final regular season game with Nebraska to finish third in the school's history in career rushing yards?

elements.title: Khalij (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Khalij, an ancient canal in Cairo, was replaced by a boulevard in the 1890s?

elements.title: a Texas TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that following a boycott orchestrated by church groups, a Texas TV station ceased airing the controversial NYPD Blue after just a month?

elements.title: David Zonana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mexican filmmaker David Zonana wrote his first feature film after producing for two other directors?

elements.title: Brooklyn Botanic Garden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cranford Rose Garden at Brooklyn Botanic Garden was cited as having 1,200 varieties of roses?

elements.title: Qurna Queen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Qurna Queen's tomb may be the only complete royal burial exported in its entirety from Egypt?

elements.title: Çöpler mine disaster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the Çöpler mine disaster in Turkey, nine gold miners were trapped under a collapse of heap leach material?

elements.title: Townsends (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Townsends, a YouTube channel dedicated to life in 18th-century America, has featured a 1784 recipe for macaroni and cheese?
